intro: Achatocarpus balansae, commonly known as the Balansae acacia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is well adapted to arid conditions. Its small, fragrant flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various insects and animals. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
